This is a very busy tapas place in El Born.  I think I ended up walking up to the counter from the back of the bar to order from the young woman working there.  She was pretty helpful.  We ordered everything from mussels to salmon, tuna, anchovies.  Everything came out nicely presented on our plates.  It's very hectic at 2pm so there might be a little wait outside.  Everyone surrounding us seemed to be a local which was a good sign but I'm sure it's touristy too.  Be careful in this neighborhood.  The area is near the Picasso museum in the alleys but it's a popular place for the pickpocketers to hide.  Almost happend to us after we ate here and they are very sneaky.  Luckily, we didn't have anything on us.
